website_summaries.verdict: Intended for lifting glass and granite, this single suction cup lifter has a capacity to lift 125 pounds and features an indicator line that warns you if vacuum is lost.
pros: Good for lifting glass and granite
Attaches quickly to smooth, flat, nonporous surfaces
Red-line indicator warns of vacuum loss
Use between temperatures of 10 degrees and 120 degrees Fahrenheit
cons: The vacuum loss indicator may not be reliable at elevations higher than 5,000 feet

customer_reviews.title: A dry cloth to wipe is good as don't want any residues left behind
customer_reviews.text: Installed over 20 windows of high quality and extremely heavy. Used two of these per person on the bigger windows and one per person on smaller windows. Obviously always move windows low to ground incase these give out but overall they worked very well. Ensure the pad is free of dirt and same with window. A dry cloth to wipe is good as don't want any residues left behind. Always check that you have a proper pressure hold before moving windows. Highly recommend and the price is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Warner

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: cup no longer works have had less than year. I've been in the glass business for over 30 years so its not like I don't know how to use or take care of.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Only used a handful of times but flawless function and solid grip even at 100 lbs~
customer_reviews.author: Majishun

customer_reviews.title: Was worried it they would work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these units to help carry 10 large mirrors. Even though there are only a few bad reviews I was still concerned if they would work for me. They are very strong, easy to use, and one of the better prices. After carefully moving a few mirrors i gained a lot of confidence in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality item for things you can't afford to go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to move an aquarium after a scare using the cheep plastic ones. One review put it into perspective... WHY WOULD YOU TRUST AN $8.00 SUCTION ON A VERY EXPENSIVE PIECE OF GLASS THAT CAN BREAK YOU IN HALF IF DROPPED... AND THE GLASS COULD BREAK TOO. Two of these worked flawlessly on a 300lb aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Worth every penny of what I paid. I purchased a huge 600 lb aquarium. With just 4 of these suction and 4 people , one on each corner....we were able to move and lift that tank with ease. Never could we have done it without this product. I highly recommend this product !!
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Work well so far
customer_reviews.text: They work well. I've noticed that they must be flat on the surface (even a sticker on the window seemed to cause an issue) and there can't be any dirt/dust. other than that, they do work well. I used mine to install windows. a helpful note: figure out where you will be lifting from, and place the pump toward your thumb; that way you can keep the suction going in case it starts to lose suction, plus you won't then accidentally bump the release with your thumb.
customer_reviews.author: T. Berkheimer

customer_reviews.title: Value for money but not a pro-tool.
customer_reviews.text: Value for money but not a true pro-tool. Purchased 4 units to install some very large windows (i.e. 4 strong men to lift each). The cups do hold on but you MUST constantly check for red-lines. At least one the units does not hold suction for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Roger R

customer_reviews.title: The Damo suction cups performed better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to remove and install bathroom mirrors and the windows of a classic Lotus restoration. Having previously being injured from not using such a device I cannot say enough. The Damo suction cups performed better than expected. There is no doubt that I will not handle large materials without the Damo Vacuum Suction Cup. A must have for every handyman or professional
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I used these to move a very heavy (approx. #300 aquarium). It made the job so much easier. I am looking for other projects to use them. Granted, I have not had them long and cannot report on longevity, but it met my need with flying colors.
customer_reviews.author: drjack

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Worked very very well. I used it for a 3x5 3/8 plate glass fixed shower panel and a door for the same enclosure. We were able to manipulate and shim the glass into place with great accuracy because this thing grabs like a barnacle. I love that it has a carry box. I wish my stud finders and laser tape had a carry case like this tool. Nice planning on the behalf of the manufacturer. Thank you for the quality and the case.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these and have only used to install 3 windows. 1 has failed, not sure if it's the one I used or failed right out of the box. Either way this is a poor quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon A Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: One of my many jobs doing maintenance is replacing broken windows, 1/8” glass. I got two of these. So much easier with these.
customer_reviews.author: TXJalapeno

customer_reviews.title: Picture misleading
customer_reviews.text: I disliked the fact that the picture shows a suction cup with a metal handle but the actual suction cup I received had a plastic handle
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Domerese

customer_reviews.title: Works super.
customer_reviews.text: Super holding power. This item I trust to help my wife out the small bathtub we have. No instructions, but its simple, just pump the bar with the red band, a few times till it stays stuck. If it pops out, do not use, but repump till the red band goes away and its safe again.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Levine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tool for replacing glass the easy way
customer_reviews.text: These little guys are amazing. I bought 2 for a window replacement job I just finished. I replaced 32 windows in 2 days in part because these suction cups made the process of moving the windows painless and simple. They work exactly as described and I have no complaints. I only had 1 release unexpectedly and I think it was just an error on my part, fortunately no harm was done. I literally attached each cup a hundred times or better and I couldn't have done the job without them.
customer_reviews.author: joshlaymon

customer_reviews.title: worked well and easily
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace the glass part of replacement windows. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, but not the best for lifting flexible materials
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, but did not work so well for our application. We lift acrylic panels that flex when lifted. This breaks the seal. I'm sure that these suction cups would work well on more rigid materials like glass panels.
customer_reviews.author: KenK

customer_reviews.title: good for DIY one time use or several times.
customer_reviews.text: very cheaply made, not for professional use. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan G Migita

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Totally would not have any other product than this, love it
customer_reviews.author: charles r.

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it to ride on a jet plane windshield. Yeah I’m still alive.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Warren

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: These work great!!! I needed them for installing some large (18" X 120") trapezoid windows up in a gable. These where double pane with 1/4" glass both sides. I got two just so I could use a helper. They came with the plastic storage boxes. No need to spend any more. FYI this install was at 9,500', some say that the altitude makes it harder for them to work, I never had one leak down!
customer_reviews.author: Rocketman

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: One of the suction cups release grip as after suction. VEEY dangerous when I'm having my employee's use these to life mirrors that are 300+ pounds
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Ogles

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality vacuum suction cup
customer_reviews.text: I have a very large and thick sound reducing storm window that I have to occasionally remove for cleaning and ventilation. The window weighs over 100 lbs and this vacuum suction cup handles the window fine. There is no way I could remove it without this or a similar product. Quality seems good and I like the fact that if it starts to lose suction you will see red showing on the piston.
customer_reviews.author: Grigs68

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, I just don’t like plastic instead of steal
customer_reviews.author: WayneAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well and we replaced all the windows in the house. Certainly helped keep them secure while the contractor affixed them to the house. Also helped to close a crank-out window that had swelled with the moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Fess

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was using this yesterday to install glass and the pump started to release causing very dangerous situation for me and my fellow workers is there any way I can return or is there warranty????
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality suction cup and great price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and works great. Really good particularly for the price. I also bought the L-TMS Premium Quality Heavy Duty Aluminum Suction Cup which has the advantage of creating suction without needing as much pressure or the plexiglass to be as flat.
customer_reviews.author: Splinter Cell Fan

customer_reviews.title: Makes Our Job  More Efficient!
customer_reviews.text: Very strong suction. We use this 12 hours a day in an industrial facility moving large glass and panels. Easy to use with a sturdy handle. Carrying case is just basic plastic. Operation easy, anyone can use this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Wright

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and well-made. Strong enough for auto windshield transport and placement.
customer_reviews.text: I used these suction cups to move and install several large automotive windshields. These suction cups generate very strong and secure suction even on a curved windshield (2004 Ford Taurus) and I had no problems with them. The carrying/storage cases are a bonus. For the price, I don't think you could do any better than these. I would buy them again if I needed more.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Hylinski

customer_reviews.title: Best solution for moving and installing heavy mirrors.
customer_reviews.text: Two allowed me and a friend to easily move and install a series of 8' x 5', 1/4" thick mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt Adams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for moving a heavy aquarium. I had to move the aquarium twice, with two separate friends. Both times, each friend exclaimed how happy they were that I had these. They make gripping large unwieldy items MUCH easier.
customer_reviews.author: SpeakingTruths

customer_reviews.title: Keep the vacuum cup clean
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price Very similar to the Crl one Have two And will buy again
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage used once and never again because they don’t hold suction. Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Davis

customer_reviews.title: Must have for large glass or mirrors!
customer_reviews.text: I now have 4 of these, we move mirrors a lot in construction, they are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for 1 week of use
customer_reviews.text: After a week of use they loose pressure. Good for 1 week of use. Not for proffesional grade work.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Don’t buy them
customer_reviews.text: These are junk. They don’t to glass at all. Waste of money. The $7.00 suctions cups are way better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked fantastic lifting a giant 5x3 mirror
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastic lifting a giant 5x3 mirror. Would have been MUCH harder and dangerous without it. Good tool to have in the arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Seahawk

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for pulling window panes in our facility. There are a few places only accessible either by extension ladder or using these to access roof. Great product! Timely shipping and good pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This product I bought and I only used one time and got broke
customer_reviews.author: arturo torres

customer_reviews.title: Good thing I know to to remove mirrors and install ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the real deal, they have saved me hundreds. Good thing I know to to remove mirrors and install them. I own a martial arts and fitness center and they have been a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Have had them for some time now with out any issues. Good product
customer_reviews.text: They work great and I’ve had no issues with them.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Does not work! ! Zous brand??
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely displeased with this product! I just used it for the 1st time and it will not stay on the glass. The plunger holds for less than a 5 second then gives out and releases from the glass. Very unhappy about this...
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice buy, only needed them for one project. worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dan

customer_reviews.title: These work AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Order 2 kinds of suction cups for window installations. These work AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Earles

customer_reviews.title: You did it again-your job has made my job possible ...
customer_reviews.text: You did it again-your job has made my job possible. another example of the top of the line product we have come acustom too thans
customer_reviews.author: larry allen

customer_reviews.title: Easy, peasy
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded expectations. Used to remove storm windows. Handles include a pumping device, which allows you to set your desired level of suction appropriate to the item you are lifting. Suction is easily released by a simple thumb depression. Easy to use. Comes in plastic case for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: very strong suction. I was able to change skylite ...
customer_reviews.text: very strong suction. I was able to change skylite glass without going on the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Whisker

customer_reviews.title: Setting Granite panels
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for handling granite panels. You must pay attention and keep them pumped up because of loss of suction while under load panels must be clean also.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Blauvelt

customer_reviews.title: very stable and easy to use for lifting heavy glass plate
customer_reviews.text: a pair of these worked great for lifting heavy glass plates. very stable and easy to use. would recommend
customer_reviews.author: amazonbuystuff

customer_reviews.title: Okay for small stuff
customer_reviews.text: Works well even on larger windows but made of plastic so I wouldn't rely on them for real heavy projects
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Life and dollar saver.
customer_reviews.text: This great tool was the difference between hiring a glass company to swap out a round window at ladder height for big bucks, or doing it myself and saving the money for other projects. Worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Foolery

customer_reviews.title: great device and no issues
customer_reviews.text: needed to remove some huge wall mirrors and this saved alot of broken glass cleanup and probably prevented a serious injury. worked great and never lost suction. Bought only one but it had the strength to hold a 4ft by 6ft mirror. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality suction cups for replacing pr moving large heavy windows around. Worked out great for my project.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get to use them as the job changed, but the trials we did with the lifter were fabulous

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for an occasional use. I would get a better one if I used it daily.

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 of these, have owned them before, ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these, have owned them before, so I knew what I was getting. They do the job that they are intended for very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Spears

customer_reviews.title: Awsome product! I use them for moving and installing ...
customer_reviews.text: Awsome product! I use them for moving and installing large onyx wall panels, removing mirrors and setting large format tile.
customer_reviews.author: micah jowett

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Work great to remove old stuck mirrors on the wall. They work great to transport stone glass or anything that has a smooth flat surface. Good quality and just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Informed Consumer

customer_reviews.title: abs plastic seems plenty sturdy for this duty
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised, and as well other of these devices have in my experience. LIfted several 8'x4'x1/2" tempered glass panels - panels and I are still in one piece. WIll mostly be used in the future to lift plexi vitrines off of pedestals; abs plastic seems plenty sturdy for this duty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described. I can't vouch for durability, but I'm only an occasional user, so it probably won't matter for me. Pretty good at less than half the price of the competition.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Makes a moving extra large storm windows much more manageable. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Molls

customer_reviews.title: Not as heavy duty as I would have liked. Needed a few sets to do large windows
customer_reviews.text: Not as heavy duty as I would have liked. Needed a few sets to do large windows. Works well for smaller items.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie Powers

customer_reviews.title: I use this occasionally for window cleaning. I've removed ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this occasionally for window cleaning. I've removed a few 50lbs storm windows with no issue's. I always clean the glass to remove dirt before using the suction cup. It prevents micro tears in rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Ian K. Clark

customer_reviews.title: I had a problem with a sunken tile and i ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with a sunken tile and i just used this effective suction cup to pull it back up. It pull it back out with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Mahmoud

customer_reviews.title: This one feels nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when I used to work at a glass repair Shop. The man I worked with provided me with one but felt it was a bit cheap. This one feels nice and sturdy. Works awesome for all my needs. Love the quality, and simply does its job. I highly recommend this product...A MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Get a grip!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for replacing large panes of glass. Suction was strong and held very well while we maneuvered the pane into place. Wouldn't try to do glass replacement without this
customer_reviews.author: I M Ben

customer_reviews.title: They worked perfect for me using them on Windows!
customer_reviews.text: These things worked awesome! I used them to assist in carrying a triple casement window that was wood interior vinyl exterior. The windows were not light and those cups worked awesome in adding an extra handle on the Windows!
customer_reviews.author: jay a

customer_reviews.title: Well worth their price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Used it to transport our 6'x6' 3/8 dance mirrors without any problems! Saving me tons by enabling me to move them on my own instead of having to hire a glass company to move them for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sam S

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Worked just like the professional suction cup I've used in the past
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Work as we) as the ones at 4 times the price. Bought four of them and gave fhem a serious work out. Great buy! Great seller! Great Service! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BigDaddy58

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I used this to install a 3 piece shower surround made of cultured marble. The back panel was pretty heavy and this suction cup never failed.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Stachowski

customer_reviews.title: A really professional tool.
customer_reviews.text: One really professional tool. Able to handle some really big pieces of plate glass safely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good suction cup
customer_reviews.text: It was very good price for pump suction cup and I was not disappointed this one works perfectly and was very strong thinking of buying couple more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm using them to install windows and it's cold here ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using them to install windows and it's cold here they stick to glass when they come out of a cold truck and don't loose pressure for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck for the casual user.
customer_reviews.text: I put these on a window overnight to see if they would leak. In the morning they were still on the window and the plunger will still fully depressed. Oh and mine came with the case.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic...4 held a 600 pound aquarium (empty) to lift with a secure grip!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: If your moving glass.....this is a great product! We ended up moving tempered glass 6'x'6' and they worked amazing! Good buy!

customer_reviews.title: suction cup
customer_reviews.text: works awesome, super strong, i like the red indicator when its losing suction, little too big when working with curved glass

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Handled a 4x6 ft 100lb insert perfectly. Easy to use.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Cheaper feel than expected but holds on great and no breaks or problems. Recommended to use at a great savings and includes case.

customer_reviews.title: These are very sturdy and reliable - they never slipped
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy and reliable - they never slipped. The pair I bought allowed me to move more than 10 big mirrors down a flight of stairs from one karate school to another with the help of one other person. All mirrors arrived safely and we saved more than $500 in moving costs. Highly recommended!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This cup works fine I would recommend this to anyone who wants to buy

customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this product - we will use this forever in our life for mirrors, glass and slabs.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Believe the great comments about this product. Just ordered a $400 aquarium and used this product to grip the cage and it worked perfectly! No slipping and easy to use. Just pump the handle til it can't pump any more and its ready to go. To release, just push the lever on opposite end of pump. Works wonders! Highly recommended!

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: It worked GREAT! I had granite to move and could not have done it without these!

customer_reviews.text: Very nice succión cup , handles its plastic but very strong! And attached very hard to the glass more than I think

customer_reviews.title: so good. Used them to install 12 new windows of ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Used them to install 12 new windows of various sizes and they worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Updated: Review
customer_reviews.text: Recently I purchased a set of these 8" suction cups that were suppose toxins with cases, but I didn't receive the cases. After writing a negative feedback I was sent the cases. "Damo" made good on the deal. The tool is working as it should and I have received what I bought. Thank you customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Fan Five

customer_reviews.title: Every contractor needs a pair of these
customer_reviews.text: They work well. We use them for more things than I would have imagined. We have used them for setting tubs and countertops.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Cargin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but not worth the risk.
customer_reviews.text: I used these items several times without problem as I had to re locate the glass on my balcony a couple of times, without problem. Then whilst carrying a new pane of glass into the apartment building the suction let go on one of the cups. I was lucky that it was the Glazier carrying that end and he managed to catch the pane before it hit the ground, it was a $750 pane of glass.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome delivery time.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! worked great! got it the next day love it.

customer_reviews.title: If it was deeper it would be perfect. For glasses that are too concave
customer_reviews.text: If it was deeper it would be perfect. For glasses that are too concave, it doesn't make contact enough for a seal. Car quarter glasses is where i find this problem.

customer_reviews.text: Does not suction to glass, let alone anything else. I tried wetting it, still no suction. I tried completely submerged in water, still no suction.

product_meta.title: DAMO 8" Vacuum Suction Cup Heavy Duty Glass Lifter Suction Cups with ABS Handle and Hand Pump for Glass & Granite Lifting
feature_bullets: Load capacity: 150 lbs. per cup;Comes with a carrying case for free;
Fast attachment on smooth, nonporous flat surfaces;
Red-line indicator warns user of any vacuum loss;
Release valve lever permits quick and complete release;
Check valve allows repumping without loss of remaining vacuum.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars279 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
